channel.title: Posts on stupid _ prizes
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on stupid _ prizes

item.title: Mapping .Net Environments with RollerCoaster
item.description: – VIEW DEMO SITE – The Problem Because it’s difficult to explain the complexities of software configuration to those who don’t need to understand it from the “city” perspective, but only see the “house” they are building; or to management who has little to know knowledge of “how the sausage is made”, and why configuration as code takes time. And, It’s not always as simple as a few text files with key values.

item.title: Resume as Code (LaTeX)
item.description: I recently updated my resume. A few versions of my old CV and plain old resume were floating around in various cloud storage products, but thought it was time to try something new (although, it’s really not new at all). Also, interestingly enough, it’s pronounced “La Tech”:TeX (/ˈtɛx/ as in Greek, but often pronounced /tɛk/ in English) ... 'ch' like in 'loch'` \newcommand{\resumeSubheading}[4]{ \vspace{-1pt}\item \begin{tabular*}{0.97\textwidth}{l@{\extracolsep{\fill}}r} \textbf{#1} & #2 \\ \textit{\small#3} & \textit{\small #4} \\ \end{tabular*}\vspace{-5pt} } Above snipped was taken from https://github.

item.title: Hello World
item.description:
This is my first post!

This is my github pages site. Built using Hugo, and that’s kinda nifty.
